channel.title: Ws Addressing on On Code & Design
channel.description: Recent content in Ws Addressing on On Code & Design

item.title: ReplyTo in ZeroMQ using WS-Addressing
item.description: In my last post, I mentioned how one could leverage SOAP along with WS-Addressing to implement the return address pattern in ØMQ (known in the JMS world as ReplyTo and in the MSMQ world as ResponseQueue). In this post, I’ll go into more detail by giving a code example using CXF’s ØMQ transport. Below is a WSDL that is similar in many respects to the WSDL of the previous post: Like the other WSDL, this one declares that the service has an operation named sayHi.
